title: [BSC] Sync stuck since upgrade to 2022.06.06
body:
#### System information

erigon version 2022.06.6-alpha-77240899

OS & Version: Linux (debian 11)

Commit hash : 7724089985bf9cb8bb7d1bde92892256a6af859f


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Upgrade to 2022.06.06 then restart

#### Backtrace

````
INFO[06-22|20:47:15.687] Build info                               git_branch=HEAD git_tag=v2022.06.06 git_commit=7724089985bf9cb8bb7d1bde92892256a6af859f

Then nothing more happen. The service loop to "[1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=18907620 blk/second=0.000 alloc=4.0GB sys=4.5GB"

Same for me here. The only values moving are "respMax" and "dups". What irritates is, that blk/sec is 0 and the number isnt moving any upwards towards the most recent block. I, for myself downloaded the snapshot provided by BNB48Club and ran the erigon client as following: 

`erigon --chain bsc --datadir D:\bsc\data --http --http.addr 127.0.0.1 --http.port 8545 --ws --port 30311 --snapshots=false --prune= --prune.h.older=5000 --prune.r.older=5000 --prune.t.older=5000 --prune.c.older=5000`

the recent output log is as following:

```
INFO[06-23|06:39:12.220] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=18862983 blk/second=0.000 alloc=3.7GB sys=7.7GB

Same problem...
The block is Locked in 18907620 block and the number isn't moving any upwards towards.

`./build/bin/erigon --chain bsc --prune=hrtc --prune.h.older=3000000 --prune.r.older=3000000 --prune.t.older=3000000 --prune.c.older=3000000 --datadir dexpool`

@radian-rgc , not same. Your node does print Error message in logs.
@radian-rgc probably you need update to support Euler hardfork

> @radian-rgc probably you need update to support Euler hardfork

Thanks @AskAlexSharov 

I want to update erigon but need Go1.8 version, i update Golang to the last version but after run make erigon i got the below error:

```
cannot find package "github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon-lib/common/dbg" in any of:
        /usr/local/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon-lib/common/dbg (from $GOROOT)
```

What's wrong ?
@radian-rgc not go1.8, but go1.18

> @radian-rgc not go1.8, but go1.18

mistake type ðŸ˜… so what about the error ? i think somthing about GOROOT or GOPATH :/

fixed above problem by `export GO111MODULE="on"` 

and now I'm running last version and start migration 

![ccs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23151404/175345008-22c1ea05-de4e-436e-a777-0a6b3f63348c.png)

@AlexeyAkhunov do you see any insight in this logs: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4518#issue-1280890875

@AskAlexSharov 
After update erigon to the last version and migration complete, the problem come again and block locked at 18907620 ðŸ¤”ðŸ¤”

`block body hash too few txs amount: 18930041, 1, trace: [stageloop.go:125 panic.go:844 accessors_chain.go:627 accessors_chain.go:521 accessors_chain.go:1099 body_algos.go:151 stage_bodies.go:134 default_stages.go:59 sync.go:327 sync.go:235 stageloop.go:159 stageloop.go:80 asm_amd64.s:1571]`

Please help, our services are down becuse of this problem 

Thank you
Try: â€œ./build/bin/integration stage_headers â€”unwind=10_000 â€”datadir=<your_datadir>â€

Nothing change... :(

`./build/bin/integration stage_headers --unwind=10000 --datadir=dexpool`

The node is locked at 18907620 block number, is it possible to skip this block ?
"is it possible to skip this block ?" - you can try to remove this check from code, but I don't know what will happen (because I don't know root cause of the problem).

> "is it possible to skip this block ?" - you can try to remove this check from code, but I don't know what will happen (because I don't know root cause of the problem).

Can you tell which file or function can to break/skip block ?

Please help me, more than 1 day my services are down :((
Ask in our Discord

First of all thanks for the information about the snapshot of bnbclub, saved me weeks of syncing up.
Are you sure your on a suitable devel commit? I downloaded the snapshot yesterday and could sync it up without a problem, maybe it might help to download the snapshot again otherwise?

> @AlexeyAkhunov do you see any insight in this logs: [#4518 (comment)](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4518#issue-1280890875)


I can see the error is starting at Euler hard fork block, but I don't know why. perhaps that was a block from un-upgraded node, in which case it should have recovered

@AskAlexSharov I suspect these nodes that are failing like that are having the pre-alpha DB format (as they started syncing on experimental versions prior the first alpha release). @radian-rgc @Denis-score please confirm what was your previous version. To fix that, you'll probably need to reset all the block bodies and re-download them, by using
`./build/bin/integration stage_bodies --reset --datadir <datadir>`
@radian-rgc can you check a solution from this issue? https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4659#issuecomment-1177268066

Same here. I compiled Erigon from tag `v2022.07.01`

This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
